column2: lsw515, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had 2 iv Infed treatments so far. I am doing weekly treatments of 200ml each. I had gastric bipass surgery in 2009 and now cannot tolerate or absorb oral iron. I have had extreme exhaustion, headaches and feelings of shakiness. Before each treatment I am given benedryl and steroids. I do get the flushing feeling and restless leg feeling achiness all over.

column2: whtdmnds56, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have crohn's disease. I do not absorb Iron. Between low Iron, Ferritin and B-12, it is ridiculous. Infed is not something I find so easy to take. I have infusions about 3 to 4 times a year. I get severe back pain, nausea, headache, very low blood pressure and am sick for about a week with these symptoms. Once it kicks in however, I am at least able to function on a daily basis. However, I would not suggest to anyone who is able to take an oral supplement for this problem. Infed will knock you on your butt!

column2: sere, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on infed for 4-5 years. Have experienced some side effects mentioned in other posts. I have a question for other iron dextran patients. Have you noticed extreme drying of skin especially on face?

column2: Tibbar, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I lost a lot of blood over a months time from uterine fibroids.  I then had a hysterectomy wher I lost more blood.  My iron level was 13.  I took the IV iron treatment yesterday and I felt like they gave me lead.  I've never been so tired in my life.  I'm looking forwards to some benefits over the next few days.  This is heavy duty stuff.

column2: darren, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I thought I was going to die. Immediate severe pain in chest like crushing pain, moving to full length of spinal muscles. low blood pressure and loss of consciousness.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: rlm, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: i had a two minute siezure at the doctors office from infed,and woke up surrounded by ems. and ended up in the er. i told the nurse at the office before the siezure that my back was in pain and  my legs were numb.

column2: 3WhiteCats, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I feel like a new woman about 8 days after these treatments. I would reccommend pushing as much fluid as possible during treatment.  The first time I had severe muscle pain & cramping in my back for about 8 days, but the pharmacist reccommended slowing the infusion rate and drinking as much fluid as possible (park yourself near a bathroom...) and it worked!  The results are definitely worth the treatment.  I still feel a little derained after infusions, but when the iron levels peak a week later, I remember why I go through this every year. It is definitely worth it.

column2: jimbob, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First of all, thanks to some of the other reviewers for scaring the begeezus out of me prior to my treatment! My treatment was prefaced with bags of steroids, benedryl, and one for nausea like prilosec or something. Then I did a test bag, waited an hour (no reaction) and then got what amounts to a GRAM of iron dosage. All went well and I lived through it!

column2: do not take, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i was 8 months pregnant. only 2ml of test dose was given before i went into shock, and my baby's heart rate dropped to 50 bpm needless to say less than 12 minutes after dose was given, i was in operating room having an emergency c section, resulting in a 5 week early baby who was in thr NICU for two weeks!  Please do not take if you are pregnant!!!! My baby and myself almost died!

column2: TEA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The test dose and first treatment were problem free. The second dose caused back pain. I had a very severe allergic reaction on my third treatment. It occured about 30 minutes after the injection. I broke out in welts and uncontrollable itching. I had to be given steriods and Benedryl to reverse the reaction.

column2: Allergy Girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: At administration of my first dose ONLY two tenths of a cc were injected & I immediately went in to severe anaphalactic shock & nearly died.  I only had time to say pray before I was unconcious.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i JUST STARTED THE TREATMENT & I AM PREGNANT, I AM GOING ON MY 4TH DAY & HAVE REALLY BAD PAIN IN MY LOWER BACK & LEGS. i HAVE A PHOBIA OF NEEDLES & I HAVE TO CONTINUE MY TREATMENT FOR THE NEXT 9 DAY'S, I HAVE HAD 1 ANXIETY ATTACK DUE TO THIS & FEEL NO DIFFERENT THAN USUAL OTHER THAN ADDED STRESS & PAIN.

column2: Wanda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: No adverse reactions during the IV treatment but I have experienced headaches, malaise and chills the day after the infusion was givern (today)

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have received Infed via IV periodically, 2-3 times per year, for almost 5 years.  Low iron due to removal of portion of small intestine in surgery in 2002.  No adverse reactions known, however I do suffer from arthritis or hip and shoulder joint pain about constantly.  This condition has been worse in the last few months.  Could this be related?
